channel.title: Trisidia X Changing Server port
channel.description: Hello, I was wondering if anyone could help me with a problem I was having. I just downloaded the TrisidiaX Source+Client and I was just coding a few things, and I wanted to check on my progress. So I started up the source, and went to go to the client. I started that up, when I realized that it's a client that already has a server's ip in one of it's files. Well, I went to look for the Server's Ip in it's Client.java files and I couldn't find it. If anyone could help me find out where the servers ip is, it would be extremely helpful. Also, I have Windows eight, and I don't know if that would affect any of the things, but I'm just tossing that out there.

item.title: Trisidia X Changing Server port
item.dc:creator: @Not_So_Perfekt Not So Perfekt
item.description:
@Not_So_Perfekt wrote:

Yeah, I found it last night, it was already changed to 127.0.0.1 before I made any changes to it, which is weird because it didn’t start up. I ended up compiling it, and everything was fine. But, I gave up on that, my port forwarding skills are tragic, and I can’t ever seem to make it work.

Read full topic

item.title: Trisidia X Changing Server port
item.dc:creator: @lmfao_beat lmfao beat
item.description:
@lmfao_beat wrote:

Just in client.java look for server and you should change the ip in two places and thats all

Read full topic

item.title: Trisidia X Changing Server port
item.dc:creator: @Not_So_Perfekt Not So Perfekt
item.description:
@Not_So_Perfekt wrote:

Hello, I was wondering if anyone could help me with a problem I was having.
I just downloaded the TrisidiaX Source+Client and I was just coding a few things, and I wanted to check on my progress.
So I started up the source, and went to go to the client.
I started that up, when I realized that it’s a client that already has a server’s ip in one of it’s files.
Well, I went to look for the Server’s Ip in it’s Client.java files and I couldn’t find it.
If anyone could help me find out where the servers ip is, it would be extremely helpful.
Also, I have Windows eight, and I don’t know if that would affect any of the things, but I’m just tossing that out there.

Read full topic
